page.title: 05BAD WEATHER AND ISOLATION
page.content: Mendip is an exposed area.There are many problems facing the small community who live on the plateau. Without a car people find it very difficult to reach amenities which are several miles away.Isolation can lead to loneliness as settlement is widely dispersed.Public transport services are few and expensive. Farms suffer from frequent cloud,heavy rain and high winds.Thin soils and lack of sunshine make it difficult to grow crops in places.The limestone can lead to water shortages in dry summers.Many of these problems are greatly increased in winter.The area often has snow lying for several weeks.Temperatures can be very low and roads blocked frequently.
